Description: Rim sherd of pottery cup, possibly a one-handler or kantharos-style cup, with a slight ridge at the transition to the wall; slight indication of a handle root at right; very micaceous, light beige-orange clay, with matt red slip or glaze on outside; inside smoothed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AP2
Curator's comments: Marked 'AP2' in pencil. Joins British Museum 1965,0930.748 and 751, and probably from same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.750 and Boston MFA 86.932 (although the latter is marked in pencil '6')
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.218)
